title: Maintain Hygiene in Cold Weather
brief: Practice essential hygiene in cold environments to prevent skin problems and infections.
steps: Step 1: Take snow baths when washing is impractical - rub snow on sweat areas (underarms, between legs), then wipe dry.
Step 2: Wash feet daily if possible and put on clean, dry socks.
Step 3: Change underwear at least twice per week.
Step 4: If unable to wash underwear, remove it, shake it out, and air it for 1-2 hours.
Step 5: Check body and clothing for lice each night in used shelters.
Step 6: For infested clothing, use insecticide powder or hang in cold, then beat and brush.
Step 7: If shaving, do so before bed to give skin time to recover.
warnings: Skin rashes can develop into serious problems in cold weather.
Beating and brushing removes lice but not eggs.
Exposed freshly shaved skin is more vulnerable to cold injury.
